method.name: getManifest
method.description: * Returns the manifest for this JAR archive. * * @return The manifest

method.name: getManifestContentCharset
method.description: * The character set used to encode the manifest content. * Defaults to UTF-8. * You can change this property but it is not recommended as JVMs expect manifests content to be encoded using UTF-8. * * @return the character set used to encode the manifest content * @since 2.14

method.name: getMetadataCharset
method.description: * The character set used to encode JAR metadata like file names. * Defaults to UTF-8. * You can change this property but it is not recommended as JVMs expect JAR metadata to be encoded using UTF-8 * * @return the character set used to encode JAR metadata like file names * @since 2.14

method.name: manifest
method.description:
* Configures the manifest for this JAR archive. * *

The given closure is executed to configure the manifest. The {@link org.gradle.api.java.archives.Manifest} is passed to the closure as its delegate.

* * @param configureClosure The closure. * @return This.

method.name: metaInf
method.description:
* Adds content to this JAR archive's META-INF directory. * *

The given closure is executed to configure a {@code CopySpec}. The {@link org.gradle.api.file.CopySpec} is passed to the closure as its delegate.

* * @param configureClosure The closure. * @return The created {@code CopySpec}

method.name: setManifest
method.description: * Sets the manifest for this JAR archive. * * @param manifest The manifest. May be null.

method.name: setManifestContentCharset
method.description: * The character set used to encode the manifest content. * * @param manifestContentCharset the character set used to encode the manifest content * @since 2.14 * @see #getManifestContentCharset()

method.name: setMetadataCharset
method.description: * The character set used to encode JAR metadata like file names. * Defaults to UTF-8. * You can change this property but it is not recommended as JVMs expect JAR metadata to be encoded using UTF-8 * * @param metadataCharset the character set used to encode JAR metadata like file names * @since 2.14

property.name: manifest
property.description: * Returns the manifest for this JAR archive. * * @return The manifest

property.name: manifestContentCharset
property.description: * The character set used to encode the manifest content. * Defaults to UTF-8. * You can change this property but it is not recommended as JVMs expect manifests content to be encoded using UTF-8. * * @return the character set used to encode the manifest content * @since 2.14

property.name: metadataCharset
property.description: * The character set used to encode JAR metadata like file names. * Defaults to UTF-8. * You can change this property but it is not recommended as JVMs expect JAR metadata to be encoded using UTF-8 * * @return the character set used to encode JAR metadata like file names * @since 2.14
